content.description: Sit start on a large jug, make moves through a series of tufas to an obvious crux past a mini-roof.
content.location: Follow directions in the Midway boulders page. Continue past The Roadside boulder approximately 1/10 mile. Continue north towards the Peaks Crag for approximately 1/10 mile and hike up towards the cliff past a small meadow with large pine trees and look for a somewhat decent trail that will take you back south towards the boulders. Katsina is in the jumble of boulders. Other hiking options exist, but this way is best for minimal log hopping.

content.description: Short and steep overhang right along the trail, challenging topout.
content.location: 5 feet off the main trail - approximately 25 minutes from the trailhead.

content.description: Sit start on a large jug on the lower left side of the boulder as for Tufa-Flinchin'. Climb up and right to a series of good holds to a large move to the arete, escape early or for full value follow the arete to the top.
content.location: Follow directions in the Midway boulders page. Continue past The Roadside boulder approximately 1/10 mile. Hike up towards the cliff past a small meadow with large pine trees and look for a somewhat decent trail that will take you back south towards the boulders. Katsina is in the jumble of boulders. Other hiking options exist, but this way is best for minimal log hopping.

content.description: Sit start on decent crimps, climb left to the arete feature and figure out how to compress your way up the slick feature to better holds and a mostly casual mantle up and right.
content.location: Follow directions in the Midway boulders page. Continue past The Roadside boulder approximately 1/10 mile. Hike up towards the cliff past a small meadow with large pine trees and look for a somewhat decent trail that will take you back south towards the boulders. This problem is just above Katsina

content.description: Quality warm up on good edges and jugs with good feet. One of the first boulders established in the area.
content.location: Sit start on the arete, trend up and left.

content.description: Decent boulder pile on an east facing aspect... catches sun in the morning until early afternoon - good shade for late afternoon sessions. Numerous dead trees have fallen in this area making it somewhat difficult to manuever.
